dublin_core.dcvalue: Dixon, C. G., Martin, L. M., & Betser, S. (2018). Making Uncertainty Work: How youth manage uncertainty to shape learning trajectories in a school makerspace. In Kay, J. and Luckin, R. (Eds.) Rethinking Learning in the Digital Age: Making the Learning Sciences Count, 13th International Conference of the Learning Sciences (ICLS) 2018, Volume 3. London, UK: International Society of the Learning Sciences.

In this paper, we use positional, conceptual, and epistemological dimensions of student framing to investigate how youth navigated open-ended work in a school-based maker club, and how opportunities to pursue personally consequential learning differed across participants. We identity four ways that uncertainty functioned in interaction.
International Society of the Learning Sciences, Inc. [ISLS].
